Topic: Draw a habitat and the different living things in each
Evidence Statements: The student can identify and describe the different plants and animals found in a specific habitat, both on land and in water.
The student can illustrate detailed observations of various habitats, such as a playground, garden, forest, parking lot, pond, stream, or lake.
The student can accurately show the diversity of living things, like trees, grasses, bushes, flowering plants, lizards, squirrels, ants, fish, and clams, in their chosen habitats.
The student can compare and contrast the different types of living things across multiple habitats by showing these differences in their drawings.
The student can demonstrate patterns in plant and animal diversity by organizing their drawings to show how different environments support different life forms.
